meanings.sent1: The parthenogenic insects multiplied rapidly without needing a mate.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the parthenogenic species to understand their unique reproductive process.
meanings.sent3: The parthenogenic plants threw a party celebrating their independence from pollination.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was parthenogenic, giving birth to new ideas without external influence.
meanings.sent5: The parthenogenic lizards amazed the researchers with their ability to reproduce on their own.

meanings.definition: Capable of producing offspring without fertilization
meanings.sent1: The parthenogenic fish astonished the aquarium visitors by giving birth without a partner.
meanings.sent2: The queen bee was known for being parthenogenic, creating a colony without mating.
meanings.sent3: The parthenogenic strawberries proudly displayed their ability to bear fruit without pollination.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a parthenogenic garden, blooming with ideas that needed no external input.
meanings.sent5: The parthenogenic frogs amazed the children at the pond by hatching eggs without a male frog.

meanings.definition: Asexual reproduction in which an egg develops into a new individual without fertilization
meanings.sent1: The parthenogenic invertebrates in the lab were a subject of fascination for the students.
meanings.sent2: The biologist explained the process of parthenogenic reproduction in simple terms to the class.
meanings.sent3: The parthenogenic chickens in the coop were the talk of the town, laying eggs without a rooster.
meanings.sent4: The concept of parthenogenic birth in mythology symbolized creation without external influence.
meanings.sent5: The parthenogenic ants formed a new colony by reproducing without the need for mating.
